1.content:
Jack yawned as he crawled into bed, eager to get some sleep after the long week behind him. Sure he didn't have any plans on a Saturday night, but thats because they had spent all day moving into the new house. Mark had gotten some new clients a while back, and finally bought the house they had been looking at for a while. All day had been spent finishing what the moving company had started, and soon they had a new home, and everyone had adjustments to make. Luckily, the new house was close to Alex's house, and he had been able to come help them out for a while. Everything was finished pretty quickly, and Jack was finally able to get some shut-eye.

He stripped down, and got ready for bed. He hit the lights, and was soon sound asleep after a hard days work. Sadly, it wasn't meant to last, and he was unexpectedly woken up by a strong breeze rolling through the room. He got up to close the window, and in his delerium, didn't realize that the window was clused until he got there.

"What the...?" How was there a breeze if the window was closed.

"Don't freak out." Said a voice behind him. Yeah, right.

"AHHHHH!" Jack jumped an whirled around, only to see a girl standing behind him, rubbing her neck awkwardly. "AHHHHH!" He screamed again as it was her that talked and holy shit there was a girl in his room. And not in the good way.

"I just said don't freak out!" She said, hoping to shut him up.

"How am I supposed to not freak out, who are you and why are you in my room!" Jack said.

"Well, my name's Amanda, but as to why i'm in your room... i'm a ghost that lived in this house." Jack slowly processed the last part of the sentence. He nodded and climbed back in bed pulling the covers back over him. "What? What are you doing? that doesn't freak you out?" She was baffled.

"Look, you're obviously a dream. So, im going back to bed and you'll be gone." He said, matter-of-factly. She shook her head at the delusional boy, and went up to his bed.

"Hey!"... no reaction. "Heeey!"... still nothing. She huffed, and another gust of wind blew through the room.

"Would you stop doing that?" Jack asked, as he shivered.

"How? I'm apparantly not real." She said, ticked at the room's new inhabitant.

"Well if you could do the wind thing.... holy. shit. There's a real ghost in my room!" Jack started to panic and backed away from her, falling on the floor. She giggled and floated over to him.

"Smooth." She noticed he said nothing and just stared at her. Finally...

"Please don't eat me." He said. She sighed.

"I'm a ghost, I don't eat people. Look just let me explain why i'm here, okay?" He nodded, still, wide eyed. "Then have a seat." She gestured to the bed, and he put some shorts on and sat down next to her, finally taking a look at the ghost. She was semi-transparant (how had he not noticed that yet?), but many features were still discernable. She was cute, but Jack didn't think ghosts were very datable. She had straight brown hair, brown eyes, and for clothes, a simple white t-shirt and jeans with tennis shoes.

"Wait, why do you have clothes on if you're a ghost?" He said, still waking up. She rolled her eyes at his question. Out of all the things, of couse the guy had to go for that one.

"Well, this is just how I want to appear. I'll get to that." She could tell that he was handling it well, but was a bit overwhelmed. "First of all, as I said, my name is Amanda Reese. My parents buit this house, and I used to live here. I went to lakewood high, and was about to graduate when... I died. about a year ago. A drunk robber broke in, shot me, stole some jewels, and left. My parents were devastated, I was an only child. They packed up, and left, I don't know where. I haven't been able to leave here since I died last year. But i've gotten over it. Constant boredom will do that to ya. But when I saw you, something changed. You seemed to see me, even though I don't think you actually saw me until tonight." Jack nodded, still trying to digest what was going on. He had noticed some strange things around the house, but ignored them. Now that he thought back, it might have been her. "Well nobody else can see me but you. We're bonded now." She said, as though she was talking about the weather.

"Wait what?! I don't wan't to be a ghost!" Jack was shocked, and Amanda giggled.

"Calm down! I guess I should have explained. You see, when I died, I went to heaven. There they told me that I wouldn't get in because during the time I had spent here, I was kinda a bitch. So they said that I needed to be bonded to get into heaven. When someone sees me" She poked Jack in the chest, and he felt a chill run through it, "I am bonded to that person."

"What does that mean?" Jack asked, hoping he wouldn't be possessed or something.

"It means I am now your servant." He looked shocked at that.

"Come again?"

"Yep! They said if I wanna get in, I need to be a servant to offset my bitchiness. So since I'm bonded to you, that means I'm your servant." Jack shook his head trying to figure everything out. If he hadn't seen her float through a bed, cause a breeze, and push her hand through his chest, he wouldn't have believed her.

"Wait, I don't need a servant! You don't want to be my slave do you?" He asked, and the girl merely shrugged.

"I want to get into heaven. And they said for me to be bonded, you would have to be a special person, so I figure you would be okay. Plus theres is another factor." She said, looking away.

"And that is?"

"When we're bonded, we'll be bonded at the heart. I'll become used to your desires and wants, and personality."

"What?! Why?"

"Well because then I wouldn't mind being a servant if I wanted the same things you did, and to be with you." It made sense to the boy, and if she wanted to do it, then whatever.

"So what happens now? Are we bonded? What do I do?" He asked, flopping his arms by his side. This was a one sided conversation, and so far he was just along for the ride.

"Whatever you want. I'll do whatever you tell me to." She looked a bit frightened at the idea and took a moment to continue. "I have a bunch of cool powers and stuff that I havn't really tried out since nobody really comes near here. You can have me use those if you want. If not, you could always just go back to bed. Apparantly I can follow you wherever you go now, so if you just want to get some sleep, then i'll be here in the morning." She stopped to take it all in herself. She had waited for this moment for a year, and finally Amanda had somebody to do things with. She was excited but frightened at the prosepect. She pulled her knees up to her chin on the bed, and contemplated what this meant. Jack sat down next to her and put his hand on her shoulder, but the gesture was lost as it went right through.

"I'm pretty scared myself. I mean, you're the ghost i'm the victim." She laughed at that. "Don't worry though, it'll be fun! I promise." He wasn't too sure, but he wasn't going to tell the murdered teenage girl otherwise. "You know, I don't think I ever introduced myself. I'm Jack Thompson. I go to Lakewood high too. I'm a senior." The made small talk aout Jack's life and then after a little bit they decided they had better try and find some stuff out."So. Why don't you show me something small? Besides the wind thing, that's too cold."

"Ok!" She was pretty excited now. Jack stood up, and she floated off the bed in front of him. It was still a weird sight to see, for sure, but Jack was a pretty calm guy so he was catching on quickly. She concentrated on her being, and soon she was wearing a yellow sundress, and flip-flops.

"That's pretty cool." Jack said, impressed. She felt some new drive within herself when he said that. Like a mixture of happiness and acheivement.

"Well, now..."
